Authors: Oey E., Paramitha T., Novita N.
Title: Integrating Kano customer satisfaction coefficient and SIPA grid for service quality improvement
Source title: International Journal of Productivity and Quality Management
Affiliations: International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oey, E., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Paramitha, T., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Novita, N., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Understanding what customer wants and how to action against them is crucial for service industry, since customers and their interaction are part of the product offering. The research was a case study of a water park in east suburb of greater Jakarta area, Indonesia. The objective of the study was to help the studied company to identify what service attributes relevant for the water park and which ones are important to be improved. The study categorised service attributes using Kano model in order to capture possible nonlinear relationship between importance and satisfaction. The result was then analysed using SIPA grids by benchmarking its performance against two competitors. The result showed that currently there are only some 'keep alert attributes' and no 'key improving attributes'. However, after performing sensitivity analysis by slicing the data based on key respondents' demographic profiles, the SIPA-Kano analysis revealed some insights for possible improvement and recommendations. Author Keywords: Benchmarking; Kano CS coefficient grid; Sensitivity analysis; SIPA grid; Water park
